meanings.definition: A tool similar to an axe, used for shaping wood.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used adzes to carve intricate designs into the wooden table.
meanings.sent2: The adzes in the workshop were well-maintained and sharp for woodworking.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use the adzes to crack open a nut, thinking they were giant nutcrackers.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like adzes, shaping and sculpting the young minds in her classroom.
meanings.sent5: The ancient adzes unearthed by archaeologists revealed the craftsmanship of past civilizations.

meanings.sent1: The workers carried the heavy adzes back to the shed after a long day of work.
meanings.sent2: In the museum, the display showcased various adzes from different historical periods.
meanings.sent3: The adzes on the shelf clinked together like musical instruments when the wind blew through the window.
meanings.sent4: The adzes gleamed in the sunlight, a testament to the craftsmanship of the ancient artisans.
meanings.sent5: The collection of adzes in the exhibit provided a glimpse into the tools of the past.
